breakingChanges.title: Renamed /intake.md schema fields
breakingChanges.description: The intake schema has been reworked to support multi-step objectives. Field names have changed to better reflect the new planning loop.
breakingChanges.impact: Existing intake templates will break. Agents relying on old field names will fail to parse tasks correctly.
migration: Rename 'objective' field to 'goal' in all intake templates
Replace 'steps' array with 'plan' object containing 'phases' array
Update any scripts that parse intake.md to use new field names
Test with a sample task to verify parsing works

codeExample.before:
## Objective
Build a landing page

## Steps
- Design wireframe
- Write copy
- Implement in Next.js
codeExample.after:
## Goal
Build a landing page

## Plan
### Phases
1. **Design** - Create wireframe
2. **Content** - Write copy  
3. **Implementation** - Build in Next.js

breakingChanges.title: Added procedural memory layer
breakingChanges.description: New procedural memory layer for storing 'how-to' knowledge. Memory directory structure has changed to support three layers: episodic, semantic, and procedural.
breakingChanges.impact: Existing memory files still work but won't benefit from procedural memory. Recommended to reorganize for better memory retrieval.
migration: Create memory/procedural/ directory
Move how-to docs from memory/ to memory/procedural/
Keep daily logs in memory/episodic/ (or root for backward compatibility)
Update AGENTS.md to check memory/procedural/ for procedures
Optionally migrate MEMORY.md to memory/semantic/

codeExample.after:
memory/
├── episodic/
│   ├── 2026-02-01.md
│   └── 2026-02-02.md
├── semantic/
│   └── MEMORY.md
└── procedural/
    └── how-to-deploy.md

breakingChanges.title: GitHub App auth support required
breakingChanges.description: Personal access tokens are deprecated in favor of GitHub App authentication for better security and rate limits.
breakingChanges.impact: PAT-based authentication will continue to work but is no longer recommended. Future features may require GitHub App auth.
migration: Create a GitHub App in your organization settings
Generate a private key for your app
Install the app on repositories you want to access
Update TOOLS.md with app ID and private key path
Remove PAT from environment variables
Test authentication with a simple API call

breakingChanges.title: Enhanced database property type support
breakingChanges.description: Added support for all Notion database property types including formula, rollup, and relation. Previous versions only supported basic types.
breakingChanges.impact: No breaking changes. Existing integrations continue to work. New property types are now available for use.
migration: Review your Notion databases for advanced property types
Update skill templates to leverage new property types if needed
Test formula and relation properties with sample data
No code changes required unless using advanced properties

codeExample.before:
# Only basic properties supported:
# - text
# - number
# - date
# - checkbox
codeExample.after:
# Now supports:
# - formula (computed fields)
# - rollup (aggregations)
# - relation (linked databases)
# - and all other Notion property types

breakingChanges.title: Role handoff template for cross-lane work
breakingChanges.description: New standardized template for handing off work between lanes. Improves context preservation during hand-offs.
breakingChanges.impact: Existing hand-offs work but may lose context. Recommended to adopt new template for better coordination.
migration: Copy handoff template from skills/agent-team-kit/templates/
Update BACKLOG.md format to include handoff section
Train agents to use @mentions when handing off work
Document handoff protocol in process/LANES.md
Test with a sample cross-lane task

codeExample.before:
### Task: Build Feature X
**Lane:** dev
**Status:** ready
codeExample.after:
### Task: Build Feature X  
**Lane:** dev
**Status:** ready
**Handed from:** @scout (research lane)
**Context:** See memory/2026-02-08.md for requirements
**Next:** Implement and hand to @qa

breakingChanges.title: Improved link resolution for vault paths
breakingChanges.description: Better handling of Obsidian wiki-links and vault-relative paths. Supports multiple vaults and complex link structures.
breakingChanges.impact: No breaking changes. Link resolution is more reliable, especially for nested folders and vault-relative links.
migration: Review existing vault configurations in TOOLS.md
Test link resolution with complex vault structures
Update any hardcoded paths to use vault-relative syntax
No mandatory changes — improvements are automatic

successStories.title: Team Reflectt: Autonomy Kit 1.4 → 2.0

issues: Agents waited for prompts to start work

improvements: Agents proactively pick up queued work

successStories.testimonial: The new planning loop changed everything. Our agents went from reactive helpers to proactive team members. The intake schema rewrite was worth the migration effort.
successStories.author: Kai (Team Reflectt)

successStories.title: Solo Dev: Memory Kit 1.0 → 1.2

issues: No distinction between events and knowledge

improvements: Semantic search across all memory layers

successStories.testimonial: Adding procedural memory was a game-changer. My agent now remembers how to do things, not just what happened. Migration took an hour and saved me dozens of hours since.
successStories.author: @devlife

successStories.title: AI Agency: GitHub Skill PAT → App Auth

improvements: 10x higher rate limits with App auth

successStories.testimonial: GitHub App auth should be the default. Setup took 30 minutes, saved us countless headaches with rate limits and security. Critical upgrade for any team.
successStories.author: Sarah Chen, CTO @ BuildFast AI

successStories.title: Startup: Team Kit 1.4 → 1.6
successStories.agent: Product team (3 agents: research, dev, qa)

improvements: Clear lane ownership and status tracking

successStories.testimonial: The hand-off template eliminated so much confusion. Our agents now coordinate like a real team. Worth the afternoon spent migrating.
successStories.author: Mike Torres, Founder @ ShipIt

successStories.title: Academic: Obsidian 1.0 → 1.1
successStories.testimonial: Finally my agent can navigate my complex Obsidian setup. Link resolution is flawless now. Zero effort migration, huge quality improvement.
successStories.author: Dr. Lisa Wang
